author: Liza Baron
title: 《爱在记忆消逝前》 | 威尼斯电影节 2017

content.text: Helen Mirren and Donald Sutherland take to the road for a final vacation in Italian director Paolo Virzi's first English-language film,  The Leisure Seeker.

Mirren and Sutherland play Ella and John Spencer,  who are both sick and still in love after 50 years of marriage. John suffers from dementia and Ella has sudden headaches that bode no good. But their love is so strong that rather than live separated in different medical facilities,  they decide to take a last road trip together. Virzi takes them down the East Coast to Hemingway's house in Key West. This destination makes quite a beautiful route that gives John plenty time to recite prose and poetry.

But all being said,  award-winning Virzi apparently has left his usual witty originality at home. A road movie short on comedy and drama should at least offer a keen level of observation,  but here insight is scarce and emotional resonance is faint,  suggesting the project was not a good match for the director's talents.
